column13:
7/10 APO score

They've developed a "proprietary AI offering" that includes skills-based predictive routing, automated QA across 100% of contacts via AI-enabled analysis, agent assist with automated engagement summaries, and automated voice/chatbot customizations accpremiere. 

Built on Genesys Cloud CX platform with in-house systems admin team for customization. Their philosophy: "the center of all AI for the contact center remains 'H.I.' or Human Intelligence" accpremiere — AI as agent augmentation, not replacement. Verdict: Genuinely AI-integrated at the operational level (QA, routing, agent assist), but not AI-first. A pragmatic AI adopter with a human-centric philosophy.

Utah-based outsourced sales specialist. ~4,000 global employees, founded in 1988, 60+ clients

MarketStar seems to be one of the most global outsourced sales center. It explicitly focuses on B2B sales. I wonder if our current product is applicable, but the company is super interesting.

After discussing this use case with Dyan's product lead, two main takeaways: 1) sometimes clients would pay for signals (e.g. prospects stayed on the phone for 5s/10s/30s, and not just conversion); 2) complexity is mostly in system integration and retrieving real-time calendar avail & meeting location; we can solve for this via following up via a text and a calender-booking link. So net-net, I think we should try approaching this target account. It's very unique and rather fascinating.

NEARSOL’s public materials describe “AI” in a few concrete ways, mostly as enablement around CX delivery + recruiting, plus at least one security use case via a partner.

AI in recruiting: NEARSOL Intelligence Assistant (NIA)

NEARSOL says its recruitment process uses a “smart chatbot” to automate/standardize screening questions and “apply Artificial Intelligence” to applicant interactions to evaluate cultural fit for customer service work. They name this tool as the NEARSOL Intelligence Assistant (NIA).

AI in white-label delivery: AI-driven quality checks

In NEARSOL’s white-label BPO thought leadership, they explicitly reference “AI-driven quality checks” as part of how they scale white-label programs (paired with “cultural training tailored by market”). They don’t provide implementation details (vendor/model/workflow), but they do claim AI is used in QA/quality checking.

AI in security/compliance: AI-powered continuous authentication (partner case study)

A third-party case study from Twosense describes NEARSOL using AI-powered continuous authentication to secure workforce identity on shared workstations in a “financial services contact center clean room,” highlighting “invisible, always-on authentication” and reduced MFA friction.

column26: BPO, Sales Outsourcing, Customer Service Outsourcing, Inbound Appointment Scheduling, Collections Recovery Services
column28: Valor Global is a leading BPO company headquartered in Arizona, USA, providing exceptional customer experiences through services like customer care, technical support, account management, and first-party collections. With over 1000 global team members, they deliver 24/7 onshore and offshore support using innovative technology and processes.
column31:
Y (weak Yes)

Valor Global markets a broad set of BPO services including billing, customer care, retention, tech support, scheduling, etc. but does not explicitly list debt collections or collections recovery as a standalone BPO offering on their main services pages.

The Utilities industry page on their site does include “Collections” under BPO services for utilities clients — which typically refers to account receivables follow-up for utility bills.

However, this looks specific to utility account collections within that industry workflow, not a general third-party debt recovery service.

column9:
Classic US-HQ (CEO is based in Washington) and PH-delivery company. Emphasis on virtual assistants but also include call center services (which includes sales representative -> Upsell and crosssell capacility (selling ancillary products and services to existing customers by finding opportunities to cross-sell, upsell, and promote additional goods or services)

One orange flag is its size: LinkedIn says 500-1000 employees; shows 250 employees.
column10: Heavy focus on low-cost, English-speaking virtual assistants based in the PH. "Virtudesk is for every team or entrepreneur in any industry seeking a cost-effective approach to delegating non-core tasks, avoiding burnout, and managing project timelines effectively"
column13: Low APO score. Old school website. No explicit mention of AI, but does mention the use of technology: 1)  Timedly, an advanced management system that seamlessly connects virtual assistants, management, and clients; 2) Tymbl, a cutting-edge VoIP dialer.
column17: Financial Services, Healthcare, Insurance, Public Sector, Technology
column24: Many real estate and home service companies (e.g. Compass, Berkshire Hathaway Home Services)
column26: BPO, Call Center, Customer Service Outsourcing, Virtual Receptionist, Outbound Services, B2C Telemarketing & Telesales
column28: Virtudesk is a BPO company headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, providing virtual assistant and call center services with staff outsourced from the Philippines. It offers administrative, marketing, customer service, and other support to various industries.

column9:
A great prospect. PH-owned and HQ'd contact center and KPO with a US delivery center in Vegas. Met Julian Valenzuela (second-generation owner and ceo, Filipino American entrepreneur) via CCAP as he is the chairman of CCAP SME Council. Young, friendly, energetic, open to discuss technology.

One of the rare Contact Centers that explicitly offers debt collection services: https://visayakpo.com/services/contact-center/debt-collection/. Also explicitly offers New Customer Acquisition and Customer Retention (outbound): https://visayakpo.com/services/contact-center/customer-experience/.
column10: Proudly PH BPO offering contact center, health information management and financial management services. People-centric. USP = superior customer interactions. Award winning. A key member of CCAP.
column13:
Low BPO score.

Modern website but does not explicitly mention AI. Via conversation with its owner Julian, I learned that they care about AI and are constantly evaluating new AI vendor.
